column1: In distributed system each processor has its own ___________ .
column4: c) both local memory and clock

column1: If one site fails in distributed system then ___________ .
column2: a) the remaining sites can continue operating
column3: b) all the sites will stop working
column4: c) directly connected sites will stop working

column3: b) every system in the network
column4: c) both server and every system in the network

column1: Which technique is based on compile-time program transformation for accessing remote data in a distributed-memory parallel system?
Logical extension of computation migration is ___________ .
Processes on the remote systems are identified by ___________ .
Which routing technique is used in a distributed system?
In distributed systems link and site failure is detected by ___________ .
The capability of a system to adapt the increased service load is called ___________ .
What is not true about a distributed system?
column2: a) It is a collection of processor
column4: c) They do not share memory

column1: What are the characteristics of a distributed file system?
column2: a) Its users and servers and storage devices are dispersed
column3: b) Service activity is not carried out across the network
column4: c) They have single centralized data repository
column5: d) There are multiple dependent storage devices
